allow:
Bash(git commit -m "$(cat <<''EOF''
Change default timezone from Chicago to Eastern - v3.1.7

ISSUE: ERA was showing calendar times in Chicago timezone (America/Chicago)
but the user''s actual calendar is in Eastern timezone (America/New_York).

This caused a 1-hour offset where ERA would recommend times that overlapped
with actual meetings.

EXAMPLE:
- User has meeting: 2:30 PM - 4:30 PM Eastern
- ERA saw it as: 1:30 PM - 3:30 PM Chicago (correct conversion)
- ERA recommended: 3:30 PM - 4:00 PM Chicago
- But 3:30 PM Chicago = 4:30 PM Eastern (OVERLAPS with meeting!)

THE FIX:
Changed DEFAULT_TIMEZONE from ''America/Chicago'' to ''America/New_York''

Now ERA will correctly display and recommend times in Eastern timezone.

FILES CHANGED:
- src/services/calendar.ts (DEFAULT_TIMEZONE constant)

Version: 3.1.7

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
)")
